verses.text: 1 "JESUS_END"I am the rose of Sharon, and the lily of the valleys.
2 "JESUS_END"As the lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters.
3 "JESUS_END"As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.
4 "JESUS_END"He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love.
5 "JESUS_END"Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love.
6 "JESUS_END"His left hand is under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me.
7 "JESUS_END"I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-8/" title="Song of Solomon 2:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8  "JESUS_END"The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-9/" title="Song of Solomon 2:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9  "JESUS_END"My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at the windows, shewing himself through the lattice.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-10/" title="Song of Solomon 2:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10  "JESUS_END"My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.
11 "JESUS_END"For, lo, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone;
12 "JESUS_END"The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing of birds is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;
13 "JESUS_END"The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.

14 "JESUS_END"O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, in the secret places of the stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.
15 "JESUS_END"Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes.
16 "JESUS_END"My beloved is mine, and I am his: he feedeth among the lilies.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-17/" title="Song of Solomon 2:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17  "JESUS_END"Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.
